summary: This is a sealed memorandum decision and order from Chief Judge McMahon of the SDNY, granting the government's application to modify a March 18, 2016 protective order from the civil defamation case Giuffre v. Maxwell. The modification allows the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP to comply with a grand jury subpoena for discovery materials related to the government's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and others for sex trafficking of minors.

persons.name: Colleen McMahon
persons.context: Issues the memorandum decision and order granting the government's application to modify the protective order to allow Boies Schiller to comply with a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Defendant in the civil defamation action (Giuffre v. Maxwell). She moved for the protective order and opposed modifications that would allow disclosure to law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a perpetrator of sex crimes in the underlying civil suit. The government's grand jury investigation is into him and others for trafficking minors.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Plaintiff in the civil defamation suit against Ghislaine Maxwell, alleging Maxwell defamed her by stating she was not a victim of sex crimes by Maxwell and Epstein. Represented by Boies Schiller.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.role: Criminal Defense Lawyer, Harvard Law Professor
persons.context: Moved to unseal a portion of the record in Giuffre v. Maxwell to clear his name after being publicly accused by Giuffre of perpetrating sex crimes.

persons.name: Michael Cernovich
persons.context: Sought to unseal papers filed as part of Maxwell's motion for summary judgment, arguing for transparency.

persons.name: Julie Brown
persons.context: Moved post-settlement to unseal the entire record of Giuffre v. Maxwell. Her feature story about Epstein garnered significant public interest.

persons.name: Jose A. Cabranes
persons.context: Second Circuit judge who was critical during oral argument of the district court's failure to make specific findings for keeping documents sealed.

persons.name: Robert M. Morgenthau
persons.context: The late Honorable Judge who presided over Giuffre v. Maxwell, entered the original protective order, and denied all third-party applications to unseal documents.

connections.description: Plaintiff and defendant in a civil defamation lawsuit where Giuffre alleged Maxwell defamed her regarding claims of sexual abuse by Epstein and Maxwell.
Giuffre alleged she was a victim of sex crimes perpetrated by Epstein, as referenced in the underlying defamation suit.
Maxwell is described in the document as an alleged accomplice of Epstein in assembling a network of underage girls for sex acts.
Giuffre publicly alleged Dershowitz of perpetrating sex crimes alongside Epstein, prompting Dershowitz to move to unseal court records.
The law firm represented Giuffre in the defamation litigation against Maxwell and continues to represent her on a pending appeal.
Judge Morgenthau presided over Maxwell's case, entered the protective order she requested, and denied motions to unseal documents.

events.title: Giuffre Files Defamation Suit
events.description: Virginia Giuffre commences a civil defamation lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Protective Order Entered
events.description: Judge Robert M. Morgenthau enters a protective order in Giuffre v. Maxwell, allowing parties to designate discovery materials as confidential.

events.title: Defamation Case Settled
events.description: Giuffre v. Maxwell is settled and dismissed with prejudice shortly before trial. Terms remain confidential.

events.title: Government Investigation Commences
events.description: The government commences an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and others for sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: Government Files Application
events.description: The government files an ex parte application to modify the protective order to allow Boies Schiller to comply with a grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Second Circuit Oral Argument
events.description: The Second Circuit hears argument on consolidated appeals seeking to unseal records from Giuffre v. Maxwell. The panel is critical of the district court's sealing practices.

events.title: Court Grants Modification
events.description: Chief Judge McMahon grants the government's application, modifying the protective order to permit Boies Schiller to comply with the grand jury subpoena.

locations: United States District Court, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The government is investigating Jeffrey Epstein and others for sex trafficking of minors (violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591, 1594(c), 2422(b)).
A grand jury subpoena was issued to the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP for discovery materials from the sealed civil case Giuffre v. Maxwell.
Chief Judge McMahon found that Ghislaine Maxwell's reliance on the protective order to shield materials from a grand jury subpoena was unreasonable.
The court found 'extraordinary circumstances' warranting modification, citing the serious nature of the crimes, significant public interest, and the grand jury's need for secrecy.
The document references Epstein's 2007 plea deal, a non-prosecution agreement with the DOJ, and subsequent allegations of government misconduct.
